channel.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps
channel.description: NASA’s technical workforce put boots on the Moon, tire tracks on Mars, and the first reusable spacecraft in orbit around the Earth. Learn what’s next as they build missions that redefine the future with amazing discoveries and remarkable innovations.
channel.itunes:subtitle: A podcast by NASA's Academy of Program/Project & Engineering Leadership (APPEL).
channel.itunes:summary: NASA’s technical workforce put boots on the Moon, tire tracks on Mars, and the first reusable spacecraft in orbit around the Earth. Learn what’s next as they build missions that redefine the future with amazing discoveries and remarkable innovations.
channel.itunes:keywords: APPEL, NASA, project management, systems engineering, knowledge management
channel.itunes:author: National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA)

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 95: Developmental Assignments
item.description: NASA's Nick Jedrich and Andrew Maynard discuss the benefits of developmental assignments.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 94: Mars Sample Return
item.description: Mars Sample Return Scientists Lindsay Hays and Meenakshi Wadhwa discuss the mission to return samples from the surface of Mars to Earth.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 93: Circuit Theory Application to Animal Movement
item.description: The Nature Conservancy's Kim Hall discusses the use of NASA Earth observation data to map animal movement and patterns.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 92: Evolved Structures
item.description: NASA Research Engineer Ryan McClelland discusses digital engineering technologies that are transforming classical engineering tasks and processes.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 91: OSAM-1
item.description: OSAM-1 Lead Systems Engineer Wendy Morgenstern discusses NASA's On-orbit Servicing, Assembly, and Manufacturing 1 mission to robotically refuel a satellite that wasn't designed to be serviced.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 90, Effects of Space Radiation
item.description: NASA Space Radiation Element Scientist Robin Elgart discusses research aimed at reducing radiation health risks.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 89, The Big Dig
item.description: Boston University Assistant Professor Virginia Greiman discusses enduring lessons from the largest, most technically challenging highway project in U.S. history.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 88, Ingenuity Mars Helicopter Flights
item.description: Ingenuity Mars Helicopter Chief Pilot Håvard Grip discusses the rotorcraft's history-making flights on the Red Planet.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 87, NuSTAR
item.description: NuSTAR Principal Investigator Fiona Harrison discusses NASA's Nuclear Spectroscopic Telescope Array.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 86, Astrobiology Research Coordination Networks
item.description: NASA Astrobiology Program Senior Scientist Mary Voytek discusses Research Coordination Networks.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 85, Moon to Mars Habitation
item.description: NASA's Tiffany Nickens discusses habitats being developed for living on the lunar surface and traveling to Mars.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 84, NASA’s Role in Weather Research
item.description: NASA's Edward Kim and NOAA's Pam Sullivan discuss NASA's role in weather research.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 83, NASA’s Role in Climate Research
item.description: NASA Chief Scientist and Senior Climate Advisor Kate Calvin discusses the agency's role in climate research.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 82, NASA’s Role in Agriculture
item.description: NASA Water Resources and Agriculture Program Manager Brad Doorn discusses how NASA tools and data help solve big problems on Earth.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 81, Engineering Best Practices – Part 4
item.description: NASA Johnson Space Center Engineering Director Julie Kramer White discusses the skills required to be a top-notch engineer.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 80, Engineering Best Practices – Part 3
item.description: NASA Space Launch System Chief Engineer John Blevins discusses the rigorous engineering of the world's most powerful rocket.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 79, Engineering Best Practices – Part 2
item.description: NASA Aeronautics Research Mission Directorate Chief Engineer Steve Hirshorn discusses what it takes to be a successful chief engineer.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 78, Engineering Best Practices – Part 1
item.description: NASA Chief Engineer Ralph Roe discusses engineering best practices.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 77, VERITAS
item.description: NASA's John Brophy discusses the VERITAS mission to Venus.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 76, DAVINCI
item.description: NASA's Mike Sekerak discusses the DAVINCI mission to Venus.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 75, Artemis Progress
item.description: NASA's Kristin Morgan discusses 2021 progress and what's ahead for the Artemis Program in 2022.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 74, Solar Sails
item.description: NASA's Les Johnson discusses solar sail propulsion and the upcoming Near-Earth Asteroid Scout and Solar Cruiser missions.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 73, James Webb Space Telescope
item.description: James Webb Space Telescope Program Director Greg Robinson discusses NASA's largest and most powerful space science telescope ever constructed.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 72, Dawn Mission
item.description: NASA's Marc Rayman discusses the legacy of the Dawn mission to the two most massive bodies in the main asteroid belt.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 71, Mars Oxygen In-Situ Resource Utilization Experiment
item.description: Mars Oxygen In-Situ Resource Utilization Experiment Principal Investigator Mike Hecht discusses the MOXIE technology demonstration that's generating oxygen on the Red Planet.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 70, Lucy Mission
item.description: Lucy Deputy Project Systems Engineer Mike Sekerak discusses the first space mission to study Jupiter's Trojan asteroid swarms.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 69, Parker Solar Probe
item.description: Parker Solar Probe Mission Scientist Adam Szabo discusses NASA's journey to the Sun.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 68, Lessons Learned Information System
item.description: NASA Lessons Learned Program Manager Michael Bell discusses the agency's Lessons Learned Information System.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 67, Quiet Supersonic Mission
item.description: NASA Low Boom Flight Demonstrator Deputy Project Manager Cathy Bahm discusses the X-59 quiet supersonic research mission.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 66, Convergent Aeronautics Solutions
item.description: NASA Convergent Aeronautics Solutions Project Manager Keith Wichman discusses mapping problems and solutions to transform aviation.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 65, NASA Intern Experiences
item.description: NASA Intern Nick Syracuse discusses his virtual internship experiences.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 64, Space Communications and Navigation
item.description: NASA Space Communications and Navigation Chief Engineer Neil Mallik discusses how SCaN keeps the universe connected.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 63, OSIRIS-REx Asteroid Mission
item.description: OSIRIS-REx Principal Investigator Dante Lauretta discusses the NASA mission to near-Earth asteroid Bennu.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 62, Laser Communications Relay Demonstration
item.description: NASA's Laser Communications Relay Demonstration Principal Investigator Dave Israel discusses the dynamic power of laser communications technologies.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 61, Transforming Assessment of Unsteady Aerodynamics
item.description: NASA's Nettie Roozeboom discusses a new state-of-the-art technique to measure unsteady aerodynamics using pressure-sensitive paint.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 60, Dragonfly
item.description: Dragonfly Principal Investigator Zibi Turtle discusses NASA's planned rotorcraft-lander mission to Titan.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 59, Spacecraft Window Design
item.description: NASA Spacecraft Window Design Expert Lynda Estes discusses the evolution of windows that give humans a unique view into space.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 58, SOFIA Airborne Observatory
item.description: SOFIA Project Scientist Naseem Rangwala discusses the Stratospheric Observatory for Infrared Astronomy.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 57, Shuttle Program Closeout Complexities
item.description: NASA's Johnny Nguyen discusses insight gained through closeout of the Space Shuttle Program.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 56, Model-based Systems Engineering
item.description: NASA's Terry Hill and Jessica Knizhnik discuss the agency's transition to model-based systems engineering.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 55, Psyche Mission
item.description: Psyche Mission Co-investigator Ben Weiss discusses the mission to a unique metal asteroid orbiting the Sun between Mars and Jupiter.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 54, Astrophysics Pioneers Program
item.description: NASA Astrophysicist and Pioneers Program Lead Scientist Michael Garcia discusses the new program’s first mission concepts selected for further development.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 53, Ingenuity Mars Helicopter
item.description: Ingenuity Mars Helicopter Chief Engineer Bob Balaram discusses the first experimental aircraft flight on another planet.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 52, Mars Perseverance Rover Science
item.description: Mars 2020 Perseverance Rover Deputy Project Scientist Katie Stack Morgan discusses science objectives of NASA’s first astrobiology-focused mission to the Red Planet.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 51, Advanced Air Mobility National Campaign
item.description: NASA Advanced Air Mobility National Campaign Deputy Lead Shivanjli Sharma discusses the "third revolution" in aviation.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 50, Futuristic Space Technologies
item.description: NASA Innovative Advanced Concepts Program Executive Jason Derleth discusses visionary concepts that could transform future space missions.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 49, NEEMO Case Study Deconstructed
item.description: NASA’s Bill Todd and Joyce Abbey and retired Astronaut Nicole Stott discuss NEEMO and a new case study they developed about the unique undersea analog.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 48, Mars Landing Retropropulsion Simulation
item.description: NASA's Michelle Munk, Ashley Korzun and Eric Nielsen discuss the impact of state-of-the-art computing on future NASA missions.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 47, ISS 20 – Space Station Complexity
item.description: International Space Station Flight Director Royce Renfrew discusses the complexity of the orbiting laboratory as NASA counts up to 20 years of continuous human presence in space.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 46, ISS 20 - Living in Space
item.description: American Astronaut Tracy Caldwell Dyson discusses 20 years of continuous human presence on the International Space Station.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 45, Digital Transformation
item.description: NASA Digital Transformation Officer Jill Marlowe discusses the agency’s digital transformation strategy and approach.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 44, Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite
item.description: NASA Deputy Director of Astrophysics Jeff Volosin discusses the Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite (TESS) mission.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 43, White Sands Test Facility
item.description: White Sands Test Facility Manager Bob Cort discusses the history and capabilities of the NASA facility.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 42, Game Changing Development Program
item.description: NASA Game Changing Development Program Executive Niki Werkheiser discusses advancement of space technologies that could lead to new approaches for future space missions.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 41, Technical Storytelling, Part Two
item.description: NASA’s Jon Olansen, Jenny Devolites and Ben Asher share technical stories and discuss storytelling technique with Storytelling Strategist Johel Brown-Grant.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 40, Technical Storytelling, Part One
item.description: Storytelling Strategist Johel Brown-Grant with the U.S. State Department discusses organizational benefits of technical storytelling.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 39, Plum Brook Station
item.description: Plum Brook Station Director David Stringer discusses world-unique test facilities at the NASA station in Ohio.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 38, Human Factors
item.description: NASA Armstrong Operations Engineering Branch Chief Kate McMurtry discusses the value of understanding the impact of human factors on mission performance.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 37, NASA Safety Center
item.description: NASA Safety Center Director Harmony Myers discusses resources to help achieve technical excellence in safety and mission assurance.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 36, Crowdsourcing Innovation
item.description: NASA’s Center of Excellence for Collaborative Innovation Deputy Manager Steve Rader discusses driving innovation through crowdsourcing and the gig economy.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 35, Launch America
item.description: NASA Commercial Crew Program Chief Engineers Steve Sullivan, Chris Lupo and Deborah Crane discuss the new approach for launching American astronauts to space.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 34, Science in the 2020s
item.description: NASA Scientist Michelle Thaller discusses anticipated discoveries and exciting missions planned during this decade.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 33, Young Innovators
item.description: Kenny Harris, a NASA engineer named to Forbes' 30 Under 30 Class of 2020, discusses his experiences as a young professional.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 32, Europa Clipper
item.description: Europa Clipper Project System Engineer Jennifer Dooley discusses NASA’s outer planets flagship mission.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 31, Commercial Lunar Payload Services
item.description: Steve Clarke, the Deputy Associate Administrator for Exploration in NASA’s Science Mission Directorate, discusses commercial payload delivery services to the Moon.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 30, VIPER Lunar Rover
item.description: VIPER Project Manager Dan Andrews discusses the lunar rover’s upcoming mission to look for water ice on the Moon.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 29, Centennial Challenges
item.description: Monsi Roman, NASA Centennial Challenges Program Manager, discusses the agency’s flagship prizes and competition program.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 28: Interdisciplinary Interactions
item.description: Anna McGowan, NASA’s Senior Engineer for Complex Systems Design, discusses the impact of interdisciplinary interactions on mission success.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 27, Megatrends for Engineering Systems
item.description: Anna McGowan, NASA’s Senior Engineer for Complex Systems Design, discusses engineering trends and the impact of rapid technology changes.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 26, NASA IV&V
item.description: NASA Independent Verification and Validation Program Director Greg Blaney discusses the impact of IV&V on high-profile NASA missions.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 25, NASA Technology Transfer
item.description: NASA Technology Transfer Program Executive Dan Lockney discusses the transfer of innovative space and aeronautics technologies for practical, terrestrial applications.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 24, TechPort
item.description: NASA TechPort’s Patrick Murphy and Ryan Miller discuss how technologists and innovators can use the tool to exchange ideas for groundbreaking solutions.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 23, Swamp Works
item.description: NASA Swamp Works Senior Technologist Rob Mueller discusses technologies being developed for missions to the Moon and Mars.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 22, Reflections on Columbia
item.description: NASA Goddard Space Flight Center Chief Knowledge Officer Ed Rogers discusses the complex human elements involved in disasters such as the Space Shuttle Columbia accident.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 21, NASA Human Research Program
item.description: NASA Human Research Program Director Bill Paloski discusses methods and technologies to support safe, productive human space travel to the Moon and Mars.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 20, Exploration Spacesuit Design
item.description: NASA Exploration EVA System Development Lead Jesse Buffington discusses spacesuit design for spacewalks on the Moon and Mars.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 19, Magic Inside the Orion Spacesuit
item.description: Orion Spacesuit Engineer Kirstyn Johnson discusses the internal systems of the Orion spacesuit.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 18, Orion Spacesuit Design
item.description: Orion Crew Survival Systems Project Manager Dustin Gohmert discusses Orion spacesuit design.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 17, Astronaut Training
item.description: NASA Astronaut Candidate Woody Hoburg discusses his experiences as the 2017 NASA Astronaut Class approaches the two-year mark of extensive training for space travel.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 16, Ocean-Atmosphere Understanding
item.description: Kathleen McIntyre, PACE Deputy Project Manager, discusses NASA's Plankton, Aerosol, Cloud, ocean Ecosystem mission.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 15, 20 Years of Chandra Discoveries
item.description: Chandra X-ray Observatory Project Manager Helen Cole and Project Scientist Martin Weisskopf discuss 20 years of exploring the extreme universe.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 14, Apollo Lunar Landing Training
item.description: Lisa Jones, NASA Landing and Impact Research Facility Manager, discusses the facility where the Apollo astronauts trained for the lunar landing.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 13, Apollo Legacies and Lessons Learned
item.description: Award-winning journalist, space historian and author Andrew Chaikin discusses the Apollo Program, almost 50 years after the Apollo 11 Moon landing.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 12, Flight Demonstrations and Capabilities
item.description: Brent Cobleigh, NASA Flight Demonstrations and Capabilities Project Manager, discusses new technologies that could transform air travel.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 11, Commercial Crew
item.description: Jon Cowart, a veteran space engineer, discusses NASA’s Commercial Crew Program and progress toward launching astronauts from American soil.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 10, Concurrent Engineering
item.description: The European Space Agency’s Torsten Bieler discusses how ESA uses concurrent engineering.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 9, Mars Opportunity Rover Mission
item.description: Abigail Fraeman, deputy project scientist on the Mars Exploration Rover mission, discusses the Opportunity rover mission.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 8, Engineering NASA’s Science Missions
item.description: Joe Gasbarre, NASA Science Mission Directorate Chief Engineer, discusses the engineering side of science missions.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 7, Space Shuttle Columbia National Tour
item.description: Mike Ciannilli, the agency’s manager of the Apollo, Challenger, Columbia Lessons Learned Program, previews the Space Shuttle Columbia National Tour.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 6, Artificial Intelligence
item.description: Brian Thomas, Agency Data Scientist at NASA Headquarters, discusses artificial intelligence.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 5, Big Data
item.description: John Sprague, Deputy Chief Information Officer for Technology, Data and Innovation at NASA Headquarters, discusses big data.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 4, APPEL Knowledge Services Overview
item.description: Roger Forsgren, NASA Chief Knowledge Officer and APPEL Knowledge Services Director, discusses the integration of training and knowledge sharing activities.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 3, Unleashing Innovation
item.description: David Miranda, innovation point of contact for the Exploration Ground Systems Program’s Operations Division, offers tips for unleashing innovation.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 2, Decision Velocity
item.description: An Exploration Ground Systems Program division chief, Jeremy Parsons, discusses practical ways to make quality decisions faster.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 1, Orion
item.description: Orion Program Manager Mark Kirasich discusses the challenges and opportunities of managing America’s next-generation spacecraft.

item.title: Small Steps, Giant Leaps: Episode 0, Preview
item.description: APPEL Knowledge Services presents a preview of the new Small Steps, Giant Leaps podcast.
